content: Based on the comments made by a very vocal group on these boards, it has now been determined that Bush is not responsible for any of the successes in the Middle East as he didn't give any actual orders to act, on scene. All the credit for the progress is now going to go to the military commanders who authorized the servicemembers to utilize whatever action necessary to achieve the goal. Just because he "sent" them there doesn't qualify as doing whatever was necessary to get the mission done. Bush was just a figurehead with no actual "power". Just like Obama. You wouldn't want to be two faced hypocrites and disagree with that assessment, would you?... Of all escape mechanisms, Death is the most efficient. ~~ H.L. Mencken

content: quote: Originally posted by xerello: Obviously there are those on this site who think that they could have done a better job in less time in taking out the pirates – even without knowing all the behind the scene details of all that was involved in this operation. Rush Limbaugh is one who cannot understand why it took so long for President Obama to authorize the use of lethal force. It is understandable that Rush does not realize that SEAL snipers are not stationed aboard a frigate like the USS Bainbridge and that it would take time to get these professionals in place and that setting up the shot would also take time – because he has no idea about military operations other than watching movies. Those who have served in the military should know better. This could not have been stated better. The problem is that Republicans have screwed up so badly during their years in power that all they can do now is hope for some great screwup or failure on the part of President Obama so they can use it to win the next election. The Somalia pirate situation was the moment of failure they thought they would get but instead, President Obama proved his abilities and had a successful mission. Now all the sour puss Republicans and Obama bashers here on this site can do is try to find fault in how the mission was conducted. Don't forget that former President Bush had the public's support when he went into Iraq. He certainly had my support. It was good that he took out Saddam and his genocidal hacks. But Bush cowboyed the attack. He did not send in enough troops, failed to have an after victory plan for stabilization and failed to find weapons of mass destruction he claimed Saddam had in his possession. And he also acted like an arrogant with statements such as, "Bring it on." Then, he tried to cover up his bungling by calling his correction a surge. President Obama's handling of this pirate situation was the moment of failure the Limbaugh hacks and Obama bashers were hoping to get so they could verify what they were claiming about President Obama's lack of experience. The ditto heads did not get that and so now they are sore and whining. And there are plenty of whiners and sour grapes losers here on this site who continue to look for ways to bash the President and will never give him credit for successes because they are sore losers and will continue to whine no matter how successful President Obama is with his policies. The policy he executed in the pirate situation was successful and the Republicans and their Limbaugh hacks just hate that.
